Update May 2022
**********************
So they made a lot of changes, improvements, new stuff. It's amazing how an early access game this amazing is only getting better and even though for now the game lacks multiplayer, through the nebula mod this is now also possible and works pretty well. There are ofcourse some issues that the game doesnt handle well since its playing modded and with 2 or more players for which it is not yet designed. 

But it does make the game 100x more fun, to play with friends is really worth it! And the meta-data stuff they recently put in makes restarting a new game much easier.

Looking forward to much much more from these devs! #impressed



Original review:
**********************
Ok like so many others, the game is like many other great games, but better :D

Ive played 2000+ hours of factorio. But this game pushed factorio to the side. Havent played since i got DSP.
Satisfactory similar thing. Played that for a good 1500 hours and not touching it anymore now i got Dyson Sphere Program. 
The round shapes of the map are a refreshing way of playing and remind me of my times of Planetary Annihilation. Shame we cant yet build engines to move planets closer together, now that would be a sight :D

Yes early game is a totally slow grind, but it makes it so worth it when you get to that movement speed research and unlock it. Its actually rewarding to do the research on upgrades. And the slow pace of the game is kind of relaxing. The graphics are smooth and everything looks great. And when you hit late game and start doing the Dyson Sphere, it all kind of speeds up. 

The Chingrish (google translate version of Chinese) is a problem though. The tutorial only gets you so far and you need wiki's quite often to figure out what to do. Dont even bother trying to read half of the research descriptions. That aside, it IS Early Access, so i understand its not a polished and finished product. However for the playable state it is currently in, i am genuinely impressed. Ive played more EAG's (early access games) and there are much much much worse ones out there.

[h1]@Youthcat Studios:[/h1]
[b]Love the game, but some customization would be nice like the following.[/b]
[list]
[*]Logistics: Set an amount to keep in stock and let the rest be distributed by drones. 
[*]Logistics: Trade routes. Let us set routes between specific interplanetary logistics stations so we dont get random pickups from other planets.
[*]Tutorial/Tips: Please let us [b]TURN THEM OFF![/b] Not just important tips or necessary tips. OFF should be in the list as well. When you start a new game, you are forced to listen to them all again.
[*]Removing old/wrong conveyor belts is a chore. Please make it easier, because having to backtrace every incorrect belt with the mouse is really annoying. [b]EDIT. This is now fixed![/b]
[*]Graphics customization options. My graphics card is constantly running 60+ degrees even with fans on 100%. We need to be able to turn down some stuff! (yes my gpu is slightly outdated, GTX970). [b]EDIT. Still happening, same exact issue but now with a GTX3080![/b]
[/list]

[h1]TL:DR Version[/h1]
You like Satisfactory? Dont get this, you wont play Satisfactory anymore.
You like Factorio? Dont get this either, for the same reason.
You like Planetary Annihilation? Dont get this. Its the same, but without the combat and without the planet smashing :D

[b]Seriously, Get this game, discounted or not. Its worth the money even in its current state of development. If they are going to add more over time, this is going to be an amazing game![/b]

Important warning, do not turn off the auto save function. I just did an hour ago and what do you know... game crashed and no auto-save :(

The start can be confusing and slow but as soon as you get the basics it gets really fun, the way they designed logistics is nice and it's an Exceptionally beautiful game. It also runs really well, which is baffling given the amount of items, lighting effects and how far your factory will span. Kudos to whatever black magic the devs worked to make that happen. I love that the goal of the game is the active creation of something you get to look at and admire /and/ it's useful in the game. I think some of the numbers need to be simplified as making efficient designs gets confusing very quickly, but if you don't concern yourself too much with perfect efficiency it's still really fun.

Proof-positive that not everything that comes out of China is copy-and-paste.

DSP has a charm of its own, a completely chill experience where you just build and don't have to worry about combat. I never could get into Satisfactory but its a lot like that game if you've played it - though this iteration is far more approachable and also in 3rd person view.

Side Note: the English tutorial voice-over is nothing more than a text-to-speech program which gives away the foreign roots of this game. It can get cringey at parts due to mistranslations.

Update:  I have had some time to experiment, and I think I located the issue.  It seems the broken part of the saving system is confined to the autosave portion of it.  I turned off autosave and gave the game a second try.  Ten hours later and the problem has not recurred.  So I have changed my downvote to an upvote, with the warning that the autosave is broken, and on streaming services it must be disabled.  I also feel I should point out that autosave being broken in a game that is basically all about automation is rather ridiculous.  Lastly, I know the devs have fixing saves on their radar, so in case any of them read this:  THE PROBLEM IS IN THE AUTOSAVE.

Great game.  Unless you happen to play on a streaming service.  I play on GeForce Now, and the game's ability to save appears to be broken.  Cloud saves are out of the question, which the game kindly informs you of during load.  What it doesn't tell you is that autosaves and manual saves are equally broken.  I have repeatedly lost a half hour or more of progress.  I manually save the game, then shut it down to go make a sandwich or somesuch.  When I return, the game has inexplicably rolled back my progress.  It happens both when I just lazily click 'Continue', and also when I load a save manually.  Apparently there is some issue with the size of saves, which I have heard they intend to address but they don't know when.  It seems that whatever is amiss with the saves makes the whole saving system broken for streaming services.  

So if you intend to play the game on a streaming service, I would definitely NOT recommend this game.  And if you're planning to play it locally, I also wouldn't recommend it until they fix whatever is broken with saving.
